alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 11:21PM CDT until March 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow. Total snow accumulation ranging anywhere from a dusting to 1 inch. North winds gusting up to 20 mph. * WHERE...Graham county. * WHEN...Until 4 AM CDT Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions. Affected routes include Highway 283 and Highway 24. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of heavy wet snow will develop across portions of central Kansas overnight. At this time, areas situated east of Highway 283 appear most likely to be affected. Slippery road conditions and sudden, significant reductions in visibility associated with moderate to heavy wet snow are possible for a few hours. Temperatures will remain at or above freezing. Precipitation will end from west to east prior to sunrise Friday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway on-ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. Decelerating abruptly or making sharp turns at a high rate of speed may result in loss of vehicle control. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
